name: Gl 49
scenarioDescription:
The Gl 49 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Gl 49 is a star with 0.52 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.51 times its radius. It is located 32.16 light years away from the solar system.

Gl 49 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Gl 49 system


Gl 49 b

Gl 49 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Gl 49 b is 5.63178 times the mass of Earth. At 5.63178 Earth masses, Gl 49 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Gl 49, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
